error.msg: Assigning an integer to a pointer is not portable.
error.verbose: Assigning an integer (int/long/etc) to a pointer is not portable across different platforms and compilers. For example in 32-bit Windows and linux they are same width, but in 64-bit Windows and linux they are of different width. In worst case you end up assigning 64-bit integer to 32-bit pointer. The safe way is to store addresses only in pointer types (or typedefs like uintptr_t).

error.msg: Parameter 'matrixColSize' can be declared as pointer to const
error.verbose: Parameter 'matrixColSize' can be declared as pointer to const

location.info: Parameter 'matrixColSize' can be declared as pointer to const
